reactor.tcp

Interface TcpConnection<IN,OUT>

  • Type Parameters:
    IN - The type that will be received by this connection
    OUT - The type that will be sent by this connection
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTcpConnection, NettyTcpConnection

    public interface TcpConnection<IN,OUT>
    Implementations of this class provide functionality for reading and writing to TCP connections.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  TcpConnection.ConsumerSpec<IN,OUT>
      Spec class for assigning multiple event handlers on a connection.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Close this connection.
      boolean consumable()
      Determines whether this connection can have data consumed from it.
      TcpConnection<IN,OUT> consume(reactor.function.Consumer<IN> consumer)
      Set a callback for consuming decoded data.
      reactor.core.composable.Stream<IN> in()
      Get the Stream of data coming in.
      TcpConnection.ConsumerSpec on()
      Provide the caller with a spec-style configuration object that allows a user to attach multiple event handlers to the connection.
      reactor.function.batch.BatchConsumer<OUT> out()
      Get a Consumer for output.
      TcpConnection<IN,OUT> receive(reactor.function.Function<IN,OUT> fn)
      Use the given Function to handle incoming data, like in consume(reactor.function.Consumer), but this method expects the Function to return a response object.
      java.net.InetSocketAddress remoteAddress()
      Get the InetSocketAddress of the client.
      reactor.core.composable.Promise<java.lang.Void> send(OUT data)
      Send data on this connection.
      TcpConnection<IN,OUT> send(reactor.core.composable.Stream<OUT> data)
      Send data on this connection as a Stream.
      TcpConnection<IN,OUT> sendAndForget(OUT data)
      Send data on this connection in a fire-and-forget manner.
      reactor.core.composable.Promise<IN> sendAndReceive(OUT data)
      Send data on this connection and return a Promise that will be fulfilled by the response from the peer or by an exception generated during the attempt to send.
      <T extends java.lang.Throwable> 
      TcpConnection<IN,OUT>      		 when(java.lang.Class<T> errorType, reactor.function.Consumer<T> errorConsumer)
      Set an error Consumer for errors that happen on the connection.
      boolean writable()
      Determines whether this connection can have data written to it.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
        Close this connection.

      • consumable

        boolean consumable()
        Determines whether this connection can have data consumed from it.
        Returns:
        true if the connection is consumable, false otherwise.

      • writable

        boolean writable()
        Determines whether this connection can have data written to it.
        Returns:
        true if the connection is writable, false otherwise.

      • remoteAddress

        java.net.InetSocketAddress remoteAddress()
        Get the InetSocketAddress of the client.
        Returns:
        The client's address.

      • in

        reactor.core.composable.Stream<IN> in()
        Get the Stream of data coming in.
        Returns:
        The incoming data, as a Stream.

      • out

        reactor.function.batch.BatchConsumer<OUT> out()
        Get a Consumer for output. To send data to the output using this Consumer, the caller invokes the Consumer.accept(T) method.
        Returns:
        An output Consumer.

      • when

        <T extends java.lang.Throwable> TcpConnection<IN,OUT> when(java.lang.Class<T> errorType,
                                                         reactor.function.Consumer<T> errorConsumer)
        Set an error Consumer for errors that happen on the connection.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the error.
        Parameters:
        errorType - The type of error to handle.
        errorConsumer - The Consumer when the given error occurs.
        Returns:
        this

      • consume

        TcpConnection<IN,OUT> consume(reactor.function.Consumer<IN> consumer)
        Set a callback for consuming decoded data.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The data Consumer.
        Returns:
        this

      • receive

        TcpConnection<IN,OUT> receive(reactor.function.Function<IN,OUT> fn)
        Use the given Function to handle incoming data, like in consume(reactor.function.Consumer), but this method expects the Function to return a response object.
        Parameters:
        fn - The data-consuming Function.
        Returns:
        this

      • send

        TcpConnection<IN,OUT> send(reactor.core.composable.Stream<OUT> data)
        Send data on this connection as a Stream. The implementation is expected to place a Consumer on this Stream to handle data coming in.
        Parameters:
        data - The outgoing data as a Stream.
        Returns:
        this

      • send

        reactor.core.composable.Promise<java.lang.Void> send(OUT data)
        Send data on this connection. The current codec (if any) will be used to encode the data to a Buffer. If the send fails for some reason, the returned Promise will be fulfilled with an error indicating the cause of the failure.
        Parameters:
        data - The outgoing data.
        Returns:
        A Promise that will be completed on successful send to the peer.

      • sendAndForget

        TcpConnection<IN,OUT> sendAndForget(OUT data)
        Send data on this connection in a fire-and-forget manner. If an error occurs during send, it will be reported in the usual manner and can be handle by calling when(Class, reactor.function.Consumer).
        Parameters:
        data -
        Returns:

      • sendAndReceive

        reactor.core.composable.Promise<IN> sendAndReceive(OUT data)
        Send data on this connection and return a Promise that will be fulfilled by the response from the peer or by an exception generated during the attempt to send.
        Parameters:
        data - The outgoing data.
        Returns:
        A Promise that will be fulfilled by the peer's response or an error.

      • on

        TcpConnection.ConsumerSpec on()
        Provide the caller with a spec-style configuration object that allows a user to attach multiple event handlers to the connection.
        Returns:
